column4: Hello. I'm working for a nonprofit that refurbishes old computers and looking at how they could use Linux (much more efficient on old hardware). Installing a command-line-only Ubuntu system and then kdebase, firefox, and openoffice creates a perfect setup. My question is, how can I automate this, so that we don't have to type every command for every computer we set up?
It seems you have a choice between OEM and command-line system
is there a way to do both?
I think  your question is a little advanced for most people in this channel,  also it would be good if  it wasn't just Ubuntu, but some other distros as well
